data.title: Glasgow SPT Zoning

data.text:
12 Jul 2014

#1

bruno57

New Member

Joined

12 Jul 2014

Messages

1

I am travelling up to see some of the Commonwealth games. I understand that with games tickets transport in Zones G1 - G8 is free, I was planning to drive and park near Nitsill station but not sure if this is within the G1 - G8 zoning, it seems to be on the boundary looking at the SPT maps. Could any locals advise

This map shows Nitshill station within Zone G3.

Nitshill, where I was brought up. Not a place I'd be wanting to leave my car for any length of time. Very troublesome area

I'm glad you said that - I was dithering about whether I ought to say something.

However, I did not want to be purely negative in my response, and felt I should be able to suggest an alternative.

In the absence of any other constructive suggestions, bruno57 if you want to PM me I might be able to help.

EDIT: On reflection, since you are new here, you might not be able to do that.

If you reply on here, I'll see if I can contact you.

Last edited: 12 Jul 2014

13 Jul 2014

Location

Bo'ness, West Lothian

Nitshill, where I was brought up...............Very troublesome area

What's the script with the hotel that you could see from the railway line? Has it re opened after the fire. If my memory serves me right it was a larger version of the traditional Scottish (housing scheme) pub - square concrete building "an' nae windaes". It had a reputation for shady ladies too - but I was much too young for that malarky!

How about parking on Nithsdale road (?) between Dumbreck & Maxwell Park stations. This area seems much more salubrious. When I have a large PNB at Central this is my walk of choice - casing all the "big hooses" for my nocturnal activities just like a latter day Deacon Brodie.

Last edited: 14 Jul 2014

13 Jul 2014
